choices.A: They are a set of rules that define the network routes within Snowflake.
choices.C: They are a set of rules that define how data can be transferred between different Snowflake accounts within an organization.
choices.B: They are a set of rules that dictate how Snowflake accounts can be used between multiple users.
choices.D: They are a set of rules that control access to Snowflake accounts by specifying the IP addresses or ranges of IP addresses that are allowed to connect to Snowflake.

questions.question_text: How are network policies defined in Snowflake?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Snowflake recommends using network rules in conjunction with network policies rather using this parameter. Use the BLOCKED_NETWORK_RULE_LIST parameter to specify network rules that contain IPv4 addresses.

Specifies a list of IPv4 addresses that are denied access to your Snowflake account. This is referred to as the blocked list.

Set this parameter only when you are allowing access to a range of IP addresses (specified in ALLOWED_IP_LIST), but want to deny access to one or more IP addresses within the range.

questions.question_text: What is the only supported character set for loading and unloading data from all supported file formats?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
For loading data from delimited files (CSV, TSV, etc.), UTF-8 is the default. 

For loading data from all other supported file formats (JSON, Avro, etc.), as well as unloading data, UTF-8 is the only supported character set.

questions.question_text: Which function is used to convert rows in a relational table to a single VARIANT column?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
REMOVE
Removes files from either an external (external cloud storage) or internal (i.e. Snowflake) stage.
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/sql/remove

Staged files can be deleted from a Snowflake stage (user stage, table stage, or named stage) using the following methods:

Files that were loaded successfully can be deleted from the stage during a load by specifying the PURGE copy option in the COPY INTO <table> command.

After the load completes, use the REMOVE command to remove the files in the stage.
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/data-load-considerations-manage

questions.question_text: Which command can be used to delete staged files from a Snowflake stage when the files are no longer needed?

A virtual warehouse initially suffers from poor performance as a result of queries from multiple concurrent processes that are queuing. Over time, the problem resolved.

What action can be taken to prevent this from happening again?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Multi-cluster warehouses are designed specifically for handling queuing and performance issues related to large numbers of concurrent users and/or queries. In addition, multi-cluster warehouses can help automate this process if your number of users/queries tend to fluctuate.
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/warehouses-considerations#multi-cluster-warehouses-improve-concurrency

choices.C: Change the multi-cluster settings to add additional clusters.
choices.D: Enable the search optimization service for the underlying tables.
choices.B: Add a cluster key to the most used JOIN key.
choices.A: Increase the size of the virtual warehouse.
